name: Porcini Mushroom Meatballs
author: Slimming World
ingredients:
- 25g dried porcini mushrooms
- 2 medium onions, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
- 250g chestnut mushrooms, finely chopped
- leaves of 5 large thyme springs
- 1kg passata with basil
- 250g smoked back bacon
- 750g beef mince (5% fat)
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1 medium egg, beaten
instructions:
**Prep:
- Soak the dried mushrooms in 200ml boiling water for 20 minutes
- Sweat off the onion and garlic for a few minutes until soft.
- Drain the porcini mushrooms, reserving the liquid, and finely chop.
- Add the mushrooms to the onions in the pan along with the chestnut mushrooms and thyme, and cook over a high heat for 4 minutes.
- Add all but the last tsp of reserved mushroom liquid, make sure no grit goes in the pan. Cook down until all the liquid is gone. Season to taste, and spoon 1/3 of the mixture into a mixing bowl.

**Sauce:
- Add the passata to the mushrooom mixture in the pan, bring to a gentle simmer and cook for 10 minutes or until reduced to quite a thick sauce.

**Meatballs:
- Put the bacon into a food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add the beed mince, dried thyme, egg, 1/2 tsp salt and some black pepper, and process breifly.
- Add the reserved mushroom mixture and pulse until well mixed.
- Divide the mixture into 20 portions, and roll them all into meatballs.

- Put the meatballs into the simmering sauce and cook for 10-15 minutes, or until cooked through.
- Serve with pasta.
